{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3567416,"name":"billbo911","username":"billbo911","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/billbo911/{size}/110890_2.png","created_at":"2025-03-24T21:41:27.546Z","cooked":"

We are working on a cord tentioning system that is ratchet based. We do not need the ratchet to be reversable. We are aware of the Ratchet Plate from Andy Mark, but are wondering if anyone knew of a smaller option that would work in basically the same fasion. We can use a cut down ratchet wrench, but were hoping for something that might be a little bit less hackery, not that we are above that sort of thing
We would prefer it to interface to 1/2" hex, but round stock would work in a pinch.

billbo911:

We can use a cut down ratchet wrench, but were hoping for something that might be a little bit less hackery, not that we are above that sort of thing

If it works it works. If you care about looks, hide it behind a cute little 3d printed case

That ratchet is basically as small as can be; I don’t understand what you’re looking for when you say you want it smaller. We bought what looks like the same part from WCP and used it in two places in our robot. Worth noting that the ratchet has quite a bit a “backlash” (i.e. distance between ratchet teeth is large).

Thanks for the heads up on the tooth spacing.
We were hoping to find something that wouldn’t stick out quite as far on each end. The AM one is fine, just a bit larger than the rest of the mechanism and thus looks a bit awkward, but as @UnoficialForth said, “If it works, it works.”.

billbo911:

We can use a cut down ratchet wrench, but were hoping for something that might be a little bit less hackery, not that we are above that sort of thing

As someone using the nearly identical WCP plate, a cut down wrench is probably going to be your most compact option.
